STBLKeyStringList.Text: (From Extolling the Might)
(From Talking With a Resistance Hero)
When you're ready to head to Batuu, click on your phone and select 'Take a Vacation' in the Travel menu, then select Batuu. When you see the map of Batuu, head over to Black Spire Outpost!
Are you sure you want to cancel this mission?
{1.SimFirstName} passed that check thanks to {M1.his}{F1.her} fake ID. Too bad it's too risky to use twice.
I am glad you have seen the error of your ways. You will join our ranks to snuff out Resistance scum!
If you are not willing to stand with us against the Resistance there is only one option!
The Resistance can use all the help we can get. Your knowledge of the First Order will surely help us.
If you are not willing to join us you are no longer welcome here.
(From Drinking Dagobah Slug Slinger)
(From Drinking Too Much Dagobah Slug Slinger)

I'm willing to help you out but you're gonna need to do something for me first. I need a green kyber crystal... Problem is, Savi banned me from his workshop for being 'reckless' with my lightsaber. Bring me one and I'll tell you what you need to know.
I don't share information for free! If you can spare a few Galactic Credits I am sure I can make it worth your while.
I'd be willing to tell you what I know in exchange for a little something... like credits. I really like credits.
Look... I have been struggling ever since the First Order showed up, if you have any Food from one of the local shops, I have some information that could be useful to you.
The way to a scoundrel's heart is through their stomach... I'll tell you what I know if you'll bring me something to eat!

Look, Black Spire Outpost can get a little dicey at times. If you're going to thrive here, you've got to keep up your image. I'll just come out and say it... I want a porg plushie from Dok-Ondar's but I can't be seen buying one for myself. Bring me the adorable toy and you'll get all the info you're looking for...
I am in a pinch and owe a lot of scrap metal to the local junk dealer, if you can spare some I'll share the information I have.
I'm working on a little project with a droid that I'd prefer Mubo didn't find out about. Bring me some scrap metal and I'll gladly share any info I can with you.
Success! Your surveillance node has stored the access code information.\n\nNow you can Retrieve Access Codes from the comm tower control panel.
Sssh... I am who you’re looking for. We have to be careful. The First Order is always lurking. When you're ready, come talk to me again and I'll tell you the secret information.
Mission: The Defector
I knew you'd be up for the challenge. Start by using our holotable. You can find it in the Resistance bunker. Find out whatever you can about the defector, especially where we can find them!
Mission: The Defector
I suspect you are ill-intentioned, citizen. I demand to see your identification.
Droid Relationship -
Droid Relationship +
First Order Reputation
I could use some company if you wouldn't mind. Just someone to hang out with, have a chat, and enjoy the scenery.
I've been craving something from Docking Bay 7. Doesn't that sound so good? I wish I could afford it...
Times have been tough lately. If you have any credits you could spare, I could really use the help so I can buy supplies.
My droid hasn't been as functional as usual. Got any spare scrap metal?
I could go for a game of sabacc right now. Feel like playing?
Welcome to Batuu! Check your Career Panel for some helpful tips to help you explore the area!
Better luck next time!
I've seen banthas move faster than you!
Ha! You call that fighting?
Bonus Reward\n\n{2.String}
Resistance Reputation
You're lucky I had this part laying around... Nice doing business with you!\n{2.String}
I gave you a good price on this. These parts are hard to find.\n{2.String}
Hoho! Well played. Such a cunning play deserves a reward. I heard you are looking for access to the First Order archives; this card I found might be useful to you.
Scoundrel Reputation
(From Completing the Big Heist!)
I heard you ran some jobs for Dok-Ondar! Impressive. That guy doesn't trust anyone.
Hey! I saw you in action at the sabacc tables. You've got some skills. I hope I never have to play you.
Wow, it's good to see you in person. I've heard so much about you! You're exactly how I pictured you, but a little shorter.
Is it true you pulled off a heist at Canto Bight Casino? You're gonna be a legend!
Enjoy your party! Maybe someday I'll get one in my honor too... someday...
Nice to finally meet Hondo's new 'legitimate' business partner. He talks about you a lot! I mean, he talks a lot in general, but always says good stuff about you.
Hondo speaks highly of you. Keep bringing in credits and Hondo will be a friend for life!
I heard you're a friend of Dok-Ondar! Impressive. That guy doesn't trust just anyone.
I admit I thought you were as slippery as a Klatooine paddy frog when you first arrived. I'm glad Hondo saw you had 'legitimate' business potential.
I wish I had even half your accomplishments under my belt. Maybe I should sharpen my skill set...
Hondo must really like you to spend all these credits on food and drinks! You must've made him a pile of credits!
Let's toast! I'd try and get as many in as possible while the drinks are free...
I heard you outsmarted First Order stormtroopers. Maybe you could tell me how you did it sometime!
So you're the one Hondo got for the heist! Didn't think anyone could get through that many layers of security. Nice work.
So you're the one who hit the Canto Bight Casino. Pretty gutsy move! I approve.

"I'll have my officers analyze this data at once!"

Mission Complete!

To get your next mission, speak with Hondo at Oga's Cantina.

"How did you come upon this information? It doesn't matter... take your credits and go."

Mission Complete!

To get your next mission, speak with Hondo at Oga's Cantina.

"If this information leads us to the location of the Resistance, we can make you quite rich indeed."

Mission Complete!

To get your next mission, speak with Hondo at Oga's Cantina.

"These juicy tidbits are worth every galactic credit. Pleasure doing business with you."

Mission Complete!

To get your next mission, speak with Hondo at Oga's Cantina.

"This intel is really going to help us out. Thanks for your help!"

Mission Complete!

To get your next mission, speak with Hondo at Oga's Cantina.

"Perfect! I'm sure ol' Agnon would be pretty furious if he knew we had this!"

Mission Complete!

To get your next mission, speak with Hondo at Oga's Cantina.

"Nothing like a little gossip to make galactic credits change hands!"

Mission Complete!

To get your next mission, speak with Hondo at Oga's Cantina.

"Hard to believe information is free for the taking. Especially knowing what a price it can fetch!"

Mission Complete!

To get your next mission, speak with Hondo at Oga's Cantina.
Good, good! It pays to listen. And then you can listen to the sound of the galactic credits funneling into your account!
{0.SimName} has learned how to make {1.ObjectName}. It is now available on Bars.
{0.SimName} has learned how to make {1.ObjectName}. It is now available on Fridges and Stoves.

Your droid has short circuited and needs to be repaired!

(From Playing Sabacc)
(From Losing at Sabacc)
(From Winning Sabacc)
Is this a prank? Did Kasif put you up this? Kasif! Where are you? Come out! Very funny!
I'm sorry, you must have me confused with someone else...
I'm not sure I follow... are you alright, friend?
Do I look like I'm with the First Order? Keep searching...
I wish I knew... If I did, Vi would know, you would know, and you wouldn't be here drawing attention to yourself...
Careful asking questions like that... You'll have the First Order on you before you know it...
If you're trying to flirt with me, you're not doing well. You could try buying me a drink...
I have no clue what you're talking about... If I were you I would keep it down before someone from the First Order hears you.
Sounds like you've had a few too many Fuzzy Tauntauns, friend.

{0.SimFirstName}'s loyalty to the First Order has been proven through {m0.his}{f0.her} good work.

Reward Trait: Supreme Authority

{0.SimFirstName} can show {m0.his}{f0.her} power through {m0.his}{f0.her} increased ability to win fights, and make other Sims back down from hostile socials with {m0.him}{f0.her}.
This Sim is out to prove their loyalty to the First Order by stamping out the Resistance presence on Batuu.
Enforcer of Order

There is a struggle growing on Batuu and {0.SimFirstName} has only seen the beginning of it. Now is the time to make the decision of what side to choose and who to support in this struggle. Will {f0.she}{m0.he} decide to serve the First Order as they look to take control of Batuu, or be a part of the Resistance force that wants to help disrupt the First Order's plans.\n\n{0.SimFirstName} has received a gift of credits from the faction {f0.she}{m0.he} has given {f0.her}{m0.his} support. Use them wisely.
On the world of Batuu there is a growing conflict. This Sim is out to explore Black Spire Outpost and understand whether they should stand with the Resistance or the First Order.
Hope VS Order

{0.SimFirstName} is true to the Resistance, spreading hope through Batuu as the light to inspire others to join the cause.

Reward Trait: Heroic Presence

{0.SimFirstName} will be able to inspire other Sims through {m0.his}{f0.her} presence.
This Sim looks to be the spark of hope that disrupts the First Order's operations on Batuu and aid the Resistance cause.
Paragon of Hope

{0.SimFirstName} has a way about {m0.him}{f0.her}, {m0.he}{f0.she} is quite crafty at being able to get everything {m0.he}{f0.she} wants without having to pick sides.

Reward Trait: Sleight of Hand

{0.SimFirstName} will have an easier time gaining credits by being able to pickpocket other Sims and {m0.he}{f0.she} can't get caught cheating at Sabacc.

This Sim isn't about choosing sides, they're happy just mingling among the smugglers, and bounty hunters on the fringe planet of Batuu. Earning a few extra credits along the way is just a bonus, no matter how they get them.
Galactic Privateer
(From being caught in a restricted area)
For the good of the galaxy, we will put an end to the Resistance. Those scum don't stand a chance with {0.SimName} on the job.
First Order Authority
(From Talking to Lt. Agnon)
Would not recommend repeating this experience more than once.
Busted
{0.SimFirstName} talked {M0.his}{F0.her} way out of a sticky situation.
Got Off Scot-Free
It's not wise to argue with those that display such might and power.
Power and Control
Some Sims have such an aura of bravery and selflessness around them. It’s inspiring to be in their presence.
A Hero's Presence
Access Granted
{0.SimName} has temporary access to a restricted First Order area.
{0.SimName} has temporary access to a restricted Resistance area.
Rookie Mistake
{0.SimName} should lay low and avoid the First Order.
Hope {0.SimName}’s superiors don’t find out about this blunder.
{0.SimName} should lay low and avoid the Resistance.
Under Watch
The First Order has issued a warning to {0.SimName}.
The Resistance seems particularly vigilant around {0.SimName}.
Got too Confident, Kid...
Caught Swiping Credits
You and your droid make an excellent team!
Partners in Crime
What? What happened?
Shocked and Dazed
{0.SimName} feels calm and at peace.
The Light Side
{0.SimName} is filled with anger and rage!
The Dark Side
With some of Hondo's wise advice on mind, {0.SimName} will experience greater success in certain... financial ventures.
Good Business
{0.SimFirstName}'s adrenaline is really pumping, but {M0.he}{F0.she} best not stick around the First Order.
Close Shave
Cannot do this while Fear the Dark Side Moodlet is active.
Survived Kylo Ren's rage. Could have been worse...
Fear the Dark Side
{0.SimName} trembles at the might of the First Order and the Supreme Leader.
First Order Might
{0.SimName} is motivated to do {M0.his}{F0.her} part in restoring stability and order. {M0.He}{F0.She} won't need to take a break for a while.
Like the Jedi and Sith before you, your choices can change the galaxy...
A More Refined Weapon
{0.SimFirstName} is filled with inspiration and feels optimistic about their near-term endeavors on Batuu.
Luck of Batuu
Celebrated Scoundrel
Overwhelmed with excitement and a bit of relief. The heist of a lifetime is over, now time to celebrate!
{0.SimName} attempted to blame the recruit aboard the TIE echelon, but it ended in disaster as Lt. Agnon saw right through the lie.
Blamed Recruit
{0.SimName} was able to convince the Lt. that mistakes that bad can only be made by a low level recruits.
Blamed Recruit
{0.SimName} is filled with an overwhelming sense of confidence as they disparage the First Order with the locals.
Disparaged the First Order
{0.SimName} used their wits to find and arrest the stowaway aboard the TIE echelon.
Stowaway Arrested
{0.SimName} confidently commanded the team aboard the TIE echelon and Lt. Agnon took notice.
Ordered Recruit
The smell...it smelled like a scruffy nerf herder.
Scruffy Nerf Herder
{0.SimName} was not able to make sense of the mess of wires aboard the TIE echelon. This is not going to go over well with his fellow First Order members.
Cutting the Wrong Wire
{0.SimName} was able to keep a level head and reroute power to the TIE echelon cannons.
Speedy Rewire
The jig is up! {0.SimFirstName} needs to think fast to get out of this situation.
Spotted!
It's all a machine, partner. Live free, don't join.
Don't Join
The Resistance will be crushed under the First Order's might!
First Order Supporter
The Resistance will stop the First Order at all costs. All it takes is a spark.
Friend of the Resistance
It is nice to find a fellow supporter of the First Order.
Bringing Order
The First Order's reach extends all across the galaxy. We will stop at nothing to crush the Resistance scum.
Crushing the Resistance
Looks like not everyone shares the same enthusiasm for the First Order.
They Don't Want Order?
Looks like there are some that do not share the same compassion as the Resistance.
Desperate Times
The Resistance is strong, and we grow stronger each passing day. It is only a mater of time until we strike against the First Order.
Lighting The Fire
The Resistance needs all the supporters it can get. We must try harder.
Snuffed Flame
It is nice to find a fellow supporter of the Resistance.
We Are The Spark
Sharing tales of recent smuggling jobs brings a rush of confidence.
Anything For a Price
Looks like some tales are too tall to believe. But inside you know its true...
Nothing But Lies
Reliving legendary tales of smuggling will fill anyone with a sense of pride and accomplishment.
The Spice Won't Smuggle Itself
Did that actually happen or was it all just a dream...?
The Score Was THIS Big...
Walking through the plan step by step only further solidifies the confidence in it.
There's Hope
A feeling of pride washes over you as you reunite a lost child with their mother.
Reuniting a Family
Confronting the creature in the Batuu caves fills you with a sense of relief. Lets hope that is the last of them.
Confronting the Creature
That was a close call. Whatever that creature was it sure was not friendly...
Close Call
The Batuuan caves are filled with many treacherous obstacles. Best be careful while exploring.
Treacherous Exploration
The sound of a tooka-cat hissing can be pretty startling when in a pitch-black cave. Everyone knows they are harmless, right...?
Mistook a Tooka-cat
Discovering artwork from a Batuuan civilization really makes you think what else could be hiding in those caves.
History of Batuu
(From Talking to Rey)
...Light the fire! Inspired by Rey, {0.SimName} feels ready for anything. {M0.He}{F0.She} won't need to take a break for a while.
Ignite the Spark
Cannot do this while Nothing to Report Moodlet is active.
Everything is in order.
Nothing to Report
That exploration in the TIE echelon did not go as planned.
First Order's Worst
That exploration in the TIE echelon was a stunning example of what the First Order represents.
First Order's Finest
That exploration in the X-wing could have gone a lot better.
X-wing Amateur
That exploration in the X-wing was a display of Resistance excellence.
X-wing Ace
That exploration in the Millennium Falcon is going to be laughed about for years in Oga's Cantina.
Sorry Scoundrel
That exploration in the Millennium Falcon will be celebrated and talked about for generations.
Skilled Scoundrel
Keep building programming skill to more easily unlock crates on Batuu.
Failed to Override
Hurry and open the supply crate before you get caught!
Successful Override
Wow what a shock! Better brush up on Programming Skill before trying that again.
System Overloaded
Cannot do this while Duped
{0.SimName} really lost control of the situation. What was {M0.he}{F0.she} doing again?
Duped
(From Talking to Vi Moradi)
With the Resistance backing {0.SimName} up, the First Order better watch out!
Stand Together
{0.SimFirstName} just messed around with {M0.his}{F0.her} significant other at the dwelling in a galaxy far, far away. Who can say that!?
Outer World Fling
The locals here really know how to make visitors feel comfortable and feel right at home. {0.SimName} hasn't felt this refreshed in ages!
Batuuan Hospitality
The adventure, the secrecy and romance! It's almost like {0.SimName} is in a movie!
Two for Batuu
That dish really took {0.SimName} back to a galaxy far, far away.
Far Out Flavor
{0.SimFirstName} could spend all day reading trivia on the HoloNet.
Archives Completed
It's like being punched by a swamp slug...
Slugged
Makes the tongue tingle!
Buzzz Foam
All good things must come to an end.
Jet Crashed
Energized like a solar-powered droid at noon!
Jet Juiced
It's not easy convincing someone to take fewer Credits for something they're selling.
Nice try, but nobody is taking {0.SimFirstName}'s credits that easily!
Can't Cheat Me!
That wasn't very smooth... now the whole table knows {0.SimFirstName} is a cheater!
Sabacc Cheat
They totally switched out that card, but nobody will believe {0.SimFirstName}.
But I Know What I Saw!
Card...? What Card?
Nothing Up My Sleeve
{0.SimFirstName} has been waiting for a moment like this to make their big move. Now is their chance!
Calculated Move
No luck. Maybe if {0.SimFirstName} keeps playing though they'll eventually catch a break?
Fishing For a Break
It's easy to play confidently when you know you have the best hand in the game.
Idiot's Array
That round was quick and easy! {0.SimFirstName} has everyone's number at this table.
Knack for Sabacc
How could that hand lose!? It was the perfect play...
Not MY Credits!
{0.SimFirstName} pushed their luck in a round of sabacc and won big.
It's Payday!
Sometimes it's luck, but mostly it's pure strategy.
Pure Sabacc
They seem busy, {0.SimFirstName} will just hold their winnings for them... for now.
While No-one's Watching
The First Order needs basic supplies. Essential tasks like this are a good way to prove your worth.
Supplies in Demand
Our operatives are always in need of supplies. It may sound like a simple mission, but even the most basic of tasks can have a great impact on our cause.
Supplies in Demand

I heard you're looking to make a difference here on Batuu. I might know of a group that could use your help, but I need to make sure your 'values' match up with theirs. Start by observing the First Order and reporting back your findings. Then we'll talk about getting you an introduction.
Leap of Faith

If you're still interested in becoming our ally, we could use your help disrupting First Order transmissions. Their technology is heavily secured, but we're hoping someone with your skills can slice in undetected. Meet with our “friend” at Oga’s Cantina. They have something for you to get you started.\n\nThis is a risky task...but actions speak louder than words. Show us your dedication and afterwards we’ll take you to Vi Moradi.
Risks and Rewards

Congratulations on completing your first mission. Now that you have your bearings we recommend exploring the other neighborhoods of Batuu by clicking travel in your phone.

New Missions can be obtained from Sims with a faction icon above their head.

Continue to build your reputation with the 3 factions in order to unlock new opportunities on Batuu.
Mission Complete!

Congratulations on completing your first mission. Now that you have your bearings we recommend exploring the other neighborhoods of Batuu by clicking travel in your phone.

New Missions can be obtained from Sims with a faction icon above their head.

Continue to build your reputation with the 3 factions in order to unlock new opportunities on Batuu.

Mission Canceled.

Look for Sims with the faction icons over their heads and Ask to See Missions.

Missions are the best way to build Batuu Reputation and earn rewards on Batuu!
I’m looking for challengers to compete in a lightsaber duel. Come and find me if you’re interested. Don’t worry, I fight fair... most of the time.
Lightsaber Challenge
Dare to cross blades with me in a lightsaber challenge? All skill levels welcome! You'll walk away pockets full with galactic credits if you best me!
Ready for Action
I’m looking for a worthy opponent for a lightsaber duel. There's a fair sum of galactic credits for whoever can beat me. What do you think?
Friendly Combat
Possible Lightsaber Part
Here are a few tasks to help you get your bearings while you enjoy your time on Batuu.
Welcome to Batuu
First Order ++ Resistance --
Reward: Bonus Item
{0.String}\n{1.String}\n{2.String}

I don't encourage consorting with the vile scum of Batuu, but unfortunately they're a needed source of intel. Learn what you can, but don't stay too long.\n\nOnce you have the information, there's more work to be done.
Bottoms Up
Information is there for the taking, provided you know where to look. Utilize your network as much as you can.\n\nIf you find anything useful, report it for processing immediately.
Data Collection

The Resistance are proficient at covering their tracks. I'm sure you can uncover useful information for us with some persistence. Do whatever it takes. We can't let the trail go cold.\n\nSubmit the data for analysis after you've collected it. I'll be watching you.
Hunter Gatherer
Routine testing of our ships is necessary to ensure a top fleet. I expect hard, honest work as you carry out these maintenance drills. Cut any corners and there will be consequences.
Ship Shape
Routine testing of our ships is necessary to ensure a top fleet. I expect hard, honest work as you carry out these maintenance drills. Cut any corners and there will be consequences.
Ship Shape
Routine testing of our ships is necessary to ensure a top fleet. I expect hard, honest work as you carry out these maintenance drills. Cut any corners and there will be consequences.
Ship Shape

The First Order has just arrived on Batuu looking for the Resistance. If you are interested in joining their ranks speak with Lt. Agnon in the First Order District near the First Order Cargo building.
The First Order Needs You
We are in need of assistance with a basic supply mission. Our last courier did not return. I trust you’ll be more careful.
Better than the Predecessor

"Everything seems to be in order here. Good work."

Mission Complete!

Rewards:
{7.String}

To get your next mission, speak with Lt. Agnon at the First Order Cargo building.
First Order + Resistance -

We need to do a thorough sweep of our communications systems to make sure no there are no leaks. If the Resistance is here as we suspect... it won't take them long to try to intercept our transmissions.
Communication Fortifications
Information is power. Whoever controls it shall achieve victory. Ensure we don't have any weak links in our communications.
The Weak Link

"Excellent. Strengthening our communications is the first step to exposing the Resistance."

Mission Complete!

Rewards:
{7.String}

To get your next mission, speak with Lt. Agnon at the First Order Cargo building.
We can never have too many First Orders troops. Make it your mission to get new recruits into our ranks.
Growing the Ranks

The citizens of Batuu are under our control. Wield your power, and make sure they understand their place. Only we can save them from the pollution that is The Resistance. They will bow to us in gratitude.

Both stylish and functional, this awning is hand-crafted on Batuu from locally sourced materials. Support local artisans, buy this awning today.
Batuu Awning

This awning may be nice to look at, but it provides little cover from the wind, rain, or suns, which puts it firmly in the category of art. On more than one occasion these awnings have gone missing. Authorities suspect they are melted down and turned into droid parts.
Metal Batuu Awning

This bar will make your lot feel just like Oga's Cantina. This is perfect for bounty hunters, smugglers, rogue traders, weary travelers, or Sims that appreciate fine craftsmanship in general. Craft and display with pride, all of your Mixology creations on its luminous frosted-glass top, that will make your concoctions pop! Completely Simstagram worthy!
Cantina Bar - Standard
A longer version of the Cantina Bar - Standard. This sizable version is for those with more lot space to spare. For an even longer Bar station, you could connect with the Cantina Bar - Standard.
Cantina Bar - Long

Setting up in a corner or a tight space? The Cantina Bar - Curved is the perfect option for you! With the same look and feel as the other versions of this set, the Curved's unique shape can lead to interesting building opportunities. Try connecting with the Standard, and Long versions to create different options, or replicate Oga's Cantina layout!
Cantina Bar - Curved

DL-44s are the tried and true blasters for bounty hunters and military personnel. They are accurate and highly reliable. The DL-44 is also capable of firing charges powerful enough to penetrate Stormtrooper armor. This item can be used on Adventure Moments in and around Batuu.
DL-44 Blaster Pistol

The F-11D blaster rifle is manufactured by Sonn-Blas Corporation, and is the successor to the E-11 blaster rifle. This is also the weapon of choice for any First Order Stormtrooper. This item can be used on Adventure Moments in and around Batuu.
F-11D Blaster Rifle
A First Order Prototype Blaster. Deliver this to the Scoundrel Informant in Oga's Cantina in exchange for the Disruption Device.
Prototype Blaster
Resistance Disguise
Hondo's Package

In these times, planning is more important than ever, and having an appropriate place to plan is essential. This sturdy workspace can serve as your go-to spot for all your serious planning. I wonder what all of these colorful buttons do. Look at you... gettin' stuff done!
Serious Planning Table
This Disruption Device can be used on any control panel in the First Order District. It will give you the Encryption Sequence for the secure door in the First Order Cargo building.
Disruption Device
DJ R-3X, also know as Rex. Once a great pilot of the Star Commuter 2000, can now be found in Oga's Cantina, playing some of the hottest beats across the galaxy!
DJ R-3X
A stone archway that's lasted the tests of time, and style! Sure, it's a little rough around the edges and has seen a thing or two in its lifetime, but that's what builds character.
Weathered Stone Arch
Durable, functional, and designed to last, this First Order blast door can and will stand strong through anything the Resistance throws at it.
First Order Blast Door
Sleek and sturdy, this Resistance-style blast door is designed with security in mind. Close it, lock it, and let yourself relax, because 'almost' nothing is breaking through this resilient door.
Resistance Blast Door
Looking to make a grand entrance at your next event? Look no further than this replica cantina door. Modeled after the famous Oga's Cantina on Batuu.
Grand Entrance Cantina Door

This double gate matches its counterpart fence perfectly, but it is far less resistant to unwanted visitors, because it is a gate, and gates are designed to open.
Resistant Gate
An ancient artifact of the Jedi Order, used to preserve vast amounts of knowledge.
Jedi Holocron
An ancient artifact of the Sith, used to preserve vast amounts of knowledge.
Sith Holocron
Holds top secret plans and information that the First Order is hiding on Batuu.

Holds top secret plans and information that the Resistance is hiding on Batuu.

Function is first and foremost the priority of this durable, affordable ceiling lamp. It may not look like much, but its luminescence will outlast other lamp models by a century or more.
Routine Illumination
The street vendor claimed this rare contraption harnessed the light of rising moons, but that was a scam. It's just an ordinary lamp.
Caged Moonlight
A favorite of Starfighter mechanics and industrial craftsmen, this simple light is practical, stylish, and very, very bright.
The Mechanic's Light
Traditionally found on the exterior of shady cantinas and hideaways, this unique light is now popular indoors as well as out.
Scoundrel's Beacon
Perfect for secret sabacc dens, this light adds a touch of beauty and mystery to even the shabbiest of cantinas.
Backroom Bargain Light
A stylish, yet uncomplicated design, this lamp captures the shining simplicity of a saucer.
Simple Saucer Light

Perfect for smuggler’s dens and dwellings alike, this oversized ceiling light makes a striking impression on all who gaze upon it. It says, “I'm wealthy, I'm wicked, and if you’re wise you won’t try to cheat me.”
The Saucer Centerpiece
Inspired by the domed rooves seen around the outpost, this Ornate Domed Lamp is a perfect addition for any home wishing to bring the Batuu flair.
The Forgotten Saucer

A first class Starfighter pilot can land anywhere. An asteroid? No problem, just a touch of hull damage. A sand dune? Easy, but probably some damage to the paint. A landing pad decked out with numerous landing lights? Ideal.
Landing Lights

Found on desert planets, moisture vaporators are used to gather moisture from even the driest of climates. Equipped with the latest and greatest security systems, this device is sure to notify you if anyone tries to steal its water contents. That is one less thing to worry about!
Moisture Vaporator
Lighting the way through the dark forests where many try to stay hidden...\nHmm, that seems a little backwards. Oh well, at least you can see.
Industrial Light Shiner
This truly rust-acular light shines light in the darkest of places. Don't be afraid to use it regardless of its more rust-ic qualities.
Rust-ic Light Source

While this seems like just a simple lantern... well it is just a simple lantern... but this lantern lights the way along the streets of Black Spire Outpost. It reaches out over the streets to dimly light your way.
Outer Reaches Lantern

The lightsaber is an elegant weapon from a more civilized age. It can be used to cut through the strongest of materials. Used predominantly by Jedi and Sith, Savi has found a way to construct these refined weapons without the use of the force.
Ornate Elemental Nature Lightsaber Hilt

Crafted from the finest metals from across the galaxy. This Lightsaber display case can be used to display your favorite hilt and kyber crystal.
Lightsaber Display Case
Bright like rising moons, but much more portable.
Lunar Lantern
This looks like a porch light so why would you think it's something else?
Strange Porch Light
This capsule will emit colors based on your personal preference. If used wisely, this large capsule will make the space itself feel illuminated.
Glowing Capsule

This handsome light was mass produced to be sturdy, strong, and impervious to the elements. Well, most elements. Exposure to air can oxidize the metal, and too much sun causes additional discoloration. Whatever you do, don't spray it with water. Perhaps there are some quality control issues?
Wall Lamp of Questionable Quality
A favorite among the locals and visitors alike, Milk is a refreshing drink that is sure to delight.
Milk Stand

First Order Uniform

Control Panels can be sliced to obtain valuable information or to skim Galactic Credits.
Control Panel
Security Doors can be sliced to obtain access to a factions secure outpost.
First Order Cargo Security Door
Security Doors can be sliced to obtain access to a factions secure outpost.
Resistance Outpost Door
Scrap Metal can be used at the Droid Depot in the First Order District to obtain your very own droid.
Scrap Metal
Nobody knows exactly the origins of this peculiar looking flower, but its beauty has made it a favourite among Batuu's visitors for its colourful petals.
Batuu's Flower Braid
Brighten up your surroundings with this carved planter, brimming with botanicals! Just because you're in a tough line of work doesn't mean you can't stop and smell the flowers now and then.
Barrel 'o Botanicals
A planter from the Peka community on Batuu. This refurbished urn is stocked full of delightful river bank greenery.
Peka Planter
Collect supplies for the Resistance. Return them to complete your mission.
Resistance Crate Supplies
Gathered from scrap piles. Return these to complete your current mission.
Resistance Scrap Supplies
A collection of "gently used" mosaic tiles and grating lifted from Black Spire Outpost marketplace. Add texture, color, and character to any area for a bargain price. What a deal!
Previously-Used Flooring
These circular flooring patterns offer a minimalist approach to decorating while being incredibly durable.
Time Tested Circular Flooring
Found in the cantina, this flooring has seen many years of use, and many wild nights. If it could talk, it would have many tales to tell of fun, fights, and spilled beverages.
Rising Moons Flooring

Salvaged from an old wreck in the Galma vicinity located near the outer rim of Batuu, this piece of scrap has since been oiled and buffed to a fine finish. Once buried under sand dunes, it's now fit to adorn the classiest of ceilings.
Galma Wreckage
This generator now has a more peaceful mission - providing your home's curb appeal with a rustic decor.
Ceiling Generator

These once scrappy barrels have been repurposed into a spiffy ceiling decoration. The artist's message might not ever be fully known. Does it represent conflict? Hope? Peace? An excessive amount of barrels and tubes? Either way, it's art!
Barrel Trio
This worn banner from Oga's Cantina has seen better days, but hopefully will see better days in the future as well.
Better Days Cantina Banner
An incredibly sturdy, incredibly heavy piece of ceiling decor. Originally this piece required multiple people and several droids to install. Lucky for you, now it comes fully assembled!
Heavy Lifting Hanging Canister
Repurposed from a wrecked ship, this hanging decor has survived the harsh vacuum of space, the scrapyard, and Oga's Cantina. Can it withstand wear-and-tear from your household? Only time will tell.
Resiliently Rugged Ceiling Decor
Salvaged from a former mining vessel, this drill now hangs in Oga's Cantina. Bring an earthy, industrial vibe to your home's style!
Drill Core Decor
This slightly rusted hanging capsule may be previously owned, but is still functional and solid as ever. Includes locking illuminated keypad. If only it came with the access code...
Previously Owned Capsule
This elaborate yet humble centerpiece adds a striking look to the ceiling of Oga's Cantina. Plus it really ties the room together!
Cantina Ceiling Centerpiece
This replica of First Order weapons crates is just for looks. You can show off that you mean business even though these do not function.
First Order Heavy Weapons Crates
These crates contain a First Order stormtrooper's most essential tools: blaster rifles. You can show off that you mean business even though these do not function.
First Order Blaster Crates
The First Order are nothing if not prepared. These sharp-looking containers keep supplies clean and protected, no matter the environment they're deployed to.
First Order Crate
Were this more than just a decoration, most would be scared of the damage that these dual tanks of conflagrine-14 could do in the hands of a flametrooper.
First Order D-93 Incinerator Flamethrower Tank
The First Order is equipped to handle civil unrest on any planet they deploy to. The Z6 Riot Control Baton is the tool of choice to deal with anyone deemed a 'traitor'.
First Order Riot Response Crate
With a FWMB-10 Repeating Blaster on top and a myriad of weapons and armor below, this store of supplies is enough to equip a squad of First Order stormtroopers.
First Order Armory Supplies
This little corner of stuff is a collection of junk, scrap, whatever else you want to call it, it's exactly what it looks like. Junk.
Scrap Part Corner
Expertly carved and crafted from locally sourced wood and metalwork. If you've been looking for a giant bird-inspired sculpture, this one surely fits the bill!
Batuuan Bird Sculpture

This stone bollard was originally created with the intention to stop speeders from being able to pass into certain areas. With over 6 million known languages, these stones can easily be translated to say "Do Not Pass".
Batuuan Bollard

This stone bollard was originally created with the intention to stop speeders from being able to pass into certain areas. With over 6 million known languages, these stones can easily be translated to say "Do Not Pass".
No Go Stone
First Order Cargo was a normal building on Batuu that the First Order took over and set up a temporary HQ while hunting for the Resistance.
First Order Cargo

sculptFloor_GP09GENcantinaCeiling Placeholder Name

Worrts are brown creatures with toothy mouths and long tongues. They have inhabited planets such as Tatooine. Now you can have your very own replica of one. So real you can't even tell the difference.
Mechanical Worrt Frog

sculptFloor_GP09GENcantinaFountain Placeholder Name
The outer shell of the cantina that encloses all of the pieces.
Cantina Shell
Base of the cantina shell used in the construction of the cantina on Batuu.
Cantina Shell Base
Orthogonal Cantina Wall Base used in the construction of the cantina on Batuu.
Cantina Wall Orthogonal Base
Diagonal Cantina Wall Base used in the construction of the cantina on Batuu.
Cantina Wall Diagonal Base
Entrance Cantina Wall Base used in the construction of the cantina on Batuu.
Cantina Wall Entrance Base
A reputable replica of Strono "Cookie" Tuggs' Sienar-Chall Utilipede Transport that rests on top of Docking Bay 7 in Black Spire Outpost.
Modified Utilipede Transport

Made and installed expertly with Resistance technology and military-grade components. This archway is designed to hold together any structure... secret bases included. Not to be confused with Scout Transport spare parts.
Tunnel Support Archway
This pile of crates has been around the galaxy. No one knows quite where they originated from, or where they're going next. Could their new home be with you?
Crates of Undetermined Origin
This is another pile of crates that has been around the galaxy. No one knows quite where they originated from, where they're going next, or why they are around. What would you do with them?
More Than Crates
The Intricate Cube has so many details that it seems like it should do something, but in the end there is nothing you can use this for other than place it down and enjoy its presence.
Intricate Cube

Patented Resistance design and manufacturing. To the naked eye, this may seem like a decommissioned motor, or some structure that has no big purpose but to occupy space, but in reality this is a vital piece of equipment. Perfect to fuel every vehicle and fuel-powered equipment, this fuel crate will help keep everything operating as planned.
Inconspicuous Fuel Crate
This sturdy power droid is a reliable backup generator, should the need arise. While its conversational skills are limited, it's probably still better company than that one weird cousin you have.
Gonk Droid
These water pipes are powerful enough to transport water across the entirety of Batuu. They should be plenty strong to flush a toilet...
Black Spire Water Pipes
Bring a little color home in this handcrafted Dome of Chroma. It's available in a variety of subdued colors to enhance your space both inside and out.
Dome of Chroma

During tough times, often it's the little things in life that help us get through it, like hot water! This thermal water circulator ensures even heat distribution to your water supply making annoying ice-cold showers a thing of the past.
Thermal Water Circulator

Got a huge amount of stuff to hide? This large, portable container will hold all essential supplies, plus any partial essentials and even non-essentials. Spare parts? Toss it in! Loyal droids? Yep! One hundred collectible statuettes? Uuuuh... sure. You got it? We'll hide it.
You-Can't-See-Me Container

The DF.12 Com Turret is a ground-based turret emplacement that served as a reliable first line of defense for the Resistance. If this thing doesn't stop whatever is coming at you, I am not sure anything will.
DF.12 Com Turret

The 1.4 FD P-Tower is a light fixed anti-vehicle weapon emplacement with enough power to disable any light vehicles. The P-Tower's rugged dependability meant it could function even in the harshest environments. Good thing we don't have to worry about any AT-M6's...
1.4 FD P-Tower

"Hello? Can you hear me? What? What did you say?" Take the guesswork out of your communications with this efficient comm tower. With multiple channels to minimize interference, static and dropped transmissions are a thing of the past. Say whaaaaat?!
Comm Tower

Getting from point A to point B is a snap with this zippy landspeeder. The distressed paint job gives it a "lived in" feel. Unfortunately, since the new models came out, this version is not in demand anymore. Makes getting your hands on one pretty tough!
X-34 Landspeeder
Simple generator to route power to tools. Watch your fingers, this things gets hot when in use!
Power Generator
This replica Ithorian Gravestone was referenced from the version found on Batuu. Some even say it is the one that belonged to Dok-Ondar's parents.
Replica Ithorian Gravestone
An ornate vase from the remote Batuuan settlement of Surabat. Originally used for grain storage. Hand-crafted. Support local businesses!
Surabat Vase
A one for one replica of on of the statues from the Jedi Temple on Coruscant. Don't ask how we got access to the original.
Replica Jedi Temple Statue
Tried and true mapping technology! Chart your strategic movements and positioning with this tactical screen from the comfort of your own hidden base.
Tactical Screen
A standard, run-of-the-mill, Resistance torpedo. No camp is complete without one!
Resistance Torpedo

Designed for deep space exploration and reconnaissance, probe droids are tenacious hunters and searchers. Probe droids have many sensors, and the ones used by the Empire were armed with blasters and, in some models, shields. Their goal, once arriving at their target location, is to gather as much information as possible. If confronted after their main mission has been completed these droids have the ability to self-destruct.
Imperial Probe Droid

Little more than walking batteries, Gonk power droids shuffle along, recharging vehicles and machinery as directed by their owners or programming. While there are many versions of power droids, most of them are similar in appearance. Power droids are a common sight throughout the galaxy, however they receive little notoriety despite their critical role in both military and civilian life.
Gonk Droid
The scrap yard is where Mubo stores spare parts to sell, service, and trade droids of all types.
The scrap yard is where Mubo stores spare parts to sell, service, and trade droids of all types.
Droid Depot Storage
Gonk droids are portable power units and often need to be recharged when they run out of power. Mubo offers charging services for Batuu locals and their gonk droids... for a small fee.
Recharging Gonk Droid

Rumor has it that this not only an ancient spiritual relic of Ithor, the home planet of Dok-Ondar’s race, but also the gravestone of his parents. Ithorians are pacifist by nature and have a spirituality that is linked to plant-life. If you look closely, you can see an inscription at the base of the statute that reads, “We Wither to Bloom.”
Ithorian Gravestone

Instantly recognizable by its distinctive crown of five spires, the Jedi Temple was the home of the Jedi Order on Coruscant. Part school and part monastery, the Jedi Temple was the central hub for all Jedi activities in the galaxy during the Galactic Republic.
Jedi Temple Statue

This salvage cart is used by Mubo, the owner of the Droid Depot, to gather supplies around Batuu to allow him to restore and build droids for his customers. Hand crafted with metal tubes and leather straps, it is not the most glorious of constructions, but it gets the job done.
Salvage Cart

These pipes are used to transport water all across Black Spire Outpost, unfortunately a dianoga pup has worked its way into the system and it has refused to leave. If you look closely you can see its curious eyestalk pop up ever so often.
Black Spire Water Pipes

The X-34 is equipped with a powerful repulsorlift engine that allows it to hover a meter above ground. Enhanced by a trio of air-cooled thrust turbines, this speedy ride is a true work-orbak on any planet such as Batuu or Tatooine.
X-34 Landspeeder

The locals of Black Spire Outpost use scraps of fabric, ribbon or string, and tie them around this tree to make a wish. When the fabric or string falls away or disintegrates, the locals believe the galaxy will grant their wish.
Trilon Wishing Tree
Supply Crates are a perfect storage container to keep all of your collectibles safe. You can also use it to store your smelly fish but we do not recommend that...
Supply Crate Storage Container

A large communal bench, perfect for sitting, relaxing, and taking in the sights and sounds around you. This thing is even large enough to sit with a couple friends. Who would have thought there could be soo many activities with a simple bench!
Batuu Market Bench
A Swamp Slug specimen found in Oga's Cantina. Native to the planet Dagobah, these handsome creatures produce a delectable slime used to flavor many of the cantina's beverages.
Oga's Swamp Slug
This decorative yet functional hourglass specimen container holds two rival species separated by a small forcefield in the middle. Please refrain from tapping glass.
Rivaling Hourglass

Rumor has it this trophy was swiped from the cantina after a particularly boastful patron rested it on the counter for a moment and turned his back. The patron was bragging about how easily they had stolen it, so the actual source of the trophy is unknown.
Perpetually Stolen Trophy
Carved from petrified Batuuan wood, this Jedi crest makes an excellent addition to any home wanting to bring balance to their interior decor.
Carved Jedi Crest
While it is not as large at the First Order's TIE echelon, this small replica will remind you of the times you spent with the First Order on Batuu.
TIE echelon Replica
Whether you are a fighter, or just want people to think you are, this helmet makes for the perfect conversation starter.
Resistance Pilot Helmet
A Kalikori is a revered Twi'lek family heirloom passed from parent to child. Each generation adds to the design of the Kalikori making each one a truly unique piece of one-of-a-kind art.
Kalikori
One of your favorite beverages now comes in keg-form! Perfect for post-heist celebrations, pre-heist celebrations, and mid-heist celebrations. Adds an upcycled industrial-chic feel to any space.
Black Spire Brew Keg

She may fly fast in space, but this replica of the Millennium Falcon will just adorn your space with her glorious presence. A little reminder of a journey into space that might have involved collecting coaxium.
Millennium Falcon Replica

She may fly fast in space, but this replica of the Millennium Falcon will just adorn your space with her glorious presence. A little reminder of a journey into space that might have involved collecting coaxium.
Millennium Falcon Replica
Can't commit to a real pet? This Loth-cat carving is the perfect solution for busy travelers and anyone looking for non-sentient companionship. And just look at that sweet little face!
Loth-Cat Carving

These adorable creatures recently arrived aboard a smuggler freighter and have since made Black Spire Outpost home. This porg carving is said to bring good fortune. It's also just really, really cute.
Porg Carving
Placed in plain sight for any to see where your true loyalties lie. This once used chalice is now just for decoration and declaration of your intentions.
Ancient Sith Chalice
This intricate replica is modeled after the Resistance T-70 X-wing, flown by Resistance’s Starfighter Corps. I wonder if this one is piloted by a tiny, replica Poe Dameron.
T-70 X-wing Replica
Equipped with microphones and receivers, the Comlink is a standard handheld communication devices that is used throughout the galaxy.
Comlink
This miniature BB unit is crafted by Mubo himself. They make for a perfect decorative to commemorate your time on Batuu.
Toy BB unit

Toy R Unit
The TD2.3 Electrobinoculars are a handheld viewing device used to view things from great distances.
TD2.3 Electrobinoculars

Don't bug out from bug bites. Whether you've got ants in your pants or a big 'ol spider bite, this tonic is sure to cure what ails ya. While no one knows what it's made of, everyone knows it works. Promise!
Bug Bite Cure
Scrap Metal can be used at the Droid Depot in the First Order District to obtain your very own droid.
Scrap Metal
A Batuuan Spira mounted in hard metal. It cannot be spent, but it looks nice on a shelf. Can also be sold back home for Simoleons.
Batuuan Spira
These grenade-like weapons pack tremendous explosive power into a small sphere. Often used by bounty hunters and military forces looking for quick, yet aggressive solutions to almost any problem.
Thermal Detonator
Found throughout Batuu, this ancient clay vase is thought to be native to Batuu.
Ancient Vase
Crafted of painted iron, this smooth, tapered vase was definitely fairly purchased for resale from Merchant Row in Black Spire Outpost.
Definitely-Not-Stolen Vase
Banners to help promote your First Order affiliation back home.
First Order Banners
Banners to help promote your Resistance affiliation back home.
Resistance Banners
Banners to help promote your Scoundrel affiliation back home.
Scoundrel Banners
Banners to help promote your Star Wars pride back home.
Banners of Batuu
Orthogonal Cantina Wall used in the construction of the cantina on Batuu.
Orthogonal Cantina Wall
Back Cantina Wall used in the construction of the cantina on Batuu.
Cantina Wall Back
Diagonal Cantina Wall used in the construction of the cantina on Batuu.
Cantina Wall Diagonal
DJ R-3X Cantina Wall used in the construction of the cantina on Batuu.
Cantina Wall DJ R-3X
Entrance Cantina Wall used in the construction of the cantina on Batuu.
Cantina Wall Entrance

This state-of-the-art power isolator runs so quiet you won't even know it is there. You will never have to worry about this bad boy interrupting any of your daily activities, even the more intimate ones...
Power Isolator
Bunches of dried herbs to brighten up any Batuuan-inspired kitchen.
Batuuan Herb Cluster

Is your home in need of some ventilation? Have we got the thing for you. This state of the art industrial vent will provide all the necessary ventilation you could ever need. No matter the odor, this vent can handle it!
Industrial Vent
This round, rusted hunk of scrap metal is great decoration for any wall to deliver just the right amount of Batuu flair.
Hunk of Junk Ring
A circular vent composed of military-grade steel, designed to connect to a standard ventilation duct shaft.
Circular Vent
A square vent composed of military-grade steel, designed to connect to a standard ventilation duct shaft.
Square Vent
These carvings adorn the stone walls of Black Spire Outpost. Their exact origins have been lost in time, but some scholars believe they could be old maps of the ruins.
Batuuan Relief Carving
This decorative skull of a Mythosaur is a traditional mount of the Mandalorian Bounty Hunters.
Mythosaur Skull
A stack of well-ventilated yet secure cage-style crates. Great for adding an ambiance of danger and mystery to any home or business. What's in there?!
Keep-away Cage-Style Crates
An excellently crafted one for one replica of Oga's Cantina barback. Use each piece on its own or combine them together for your very own style and shape.
Replica Cantina Barback Cap
An excellently crafted one for one replica of Oga's Cantina barback. Use each piece on its own or combine them together for your very own style and shape.
Replica Cantina Barback Slug
An excellently crafted one for one replica of Oga's Cantina barback. Use each piece on its own or combine them together for your very own style and shape.
Replica Cantina Barback Side
An excellently crafted one for one replica of Oga's Cantina barback. Use each piece on its own or combine them together for your very own style and shape.
Replica Cantina Barback Spouts
An excellently crafted one for one replica of Oga's Cantina barback. Use each piece on its own or combine them together for your very own style and shape.
Replica Cantina Barback Worrt
A short wall of various cargo crates for adding that "lived in" industrial look and elements of mystery to any space. What's in there?!
Cargo Combo
Only the finest pieces shall be displayed on this one-of-a-kind shelf. Crafted by the hands of Batuuan locals, the Spire Gates Display Shelf is sure to be a conversation piece in any home.
Spire Gates Display Shelf
A wall of dramatically arranged cargo crates for that "lived in" industrial look. Don't just fall in love with this rugged decor... ship it!
Cargo Tableau

In times of uncertainty, every day is different. Be organized. Be prepared! Be ready for anything! This roomy storage locker has everything you need to get up and go. Even if you don't know what lies ahead, at least you know you'll be prepared for it.
Resistance Storage Locker
We like the kind of shelves that can hold all kinds of things, from golf balls to garden hoses. Good thing this shelf doesn't hold any of that, but what it does hold will surprise you.
Full Metal Shelf
Chef Strono “Cookie” Tuggs satisfies the appetites of visitors and locals alike with an array of exotic offerings featuring unusual flavors sourced from across the galaxy.
Docking Bay 7 Food and Cargo
Purchase relics of the past and collectibles of the future at Dok-Ondar's Den of Antiquities.
Dok-Ondar's Den of Antiquities
The Droid Depot is run and managed by Mubo. This is where you can order your very own droid companion.
Droid Depot
The Cave on Batuu
Caves of Batuu
Ronto Roasters is a local favorite with a wide variety of tasty options.
Ronto Roasters
A covert workshop assisting those who wish to craft a lightsaber, ancient weapon of the Jedi.
Savi's Workshop
The Dwelling can be used to satisfy your needs and rest up before a big day.
Dwelling
Not sure how helpful this sign will be back at home, as it only points to activities on Batuu, but it looks cool!
Batuu Advertisement Sign
Seen in Docking Bay 7, this sleek and minimalistic designed bar stool fits in with any industrial home design.
Metal Stool
Want to bring home the cozy feel of Oga's Cantina? Look no further than this one-of-a-kind booth! Perfect for dinner parties or hangouts with your scoundrel buddies.
Cantina Booth
Complete the perfect industrial look with these one of a kind chairs straight from Docking Bay 7. Don't ask how we got them, we know a legitimate business man.
Docking Bay 7 Chair

Repurposed with scraps from the Resistance Camp on Batuu, this is not the most luxurious of chairs, but it sure has that unique style that screams secret Resistance camp. Just don't let Kylo or Lt. Agnon know where you got it...
Reclaimed Chair
Forged by the mechanics on Batuu, this chair can withstand temperatures upwards of 5000 degrees or more! Good thing nothing ever gets that hot back home.
Industrial Chair

After a tough day of conducting legitimate business, a comfortable seat goes a long way. This simple yet sleek design offers a modest place to sit and rest your weary, hard-working feet. Sourced from completely ethical materials and labor!
Legitimate Business Bench

An opulent sofa for those in high places...or those who want to feel like they are! Plush upholstery and a finely carved frame make this the perfect perch for getting any kind of job done by any means necessary.
Big Boss Sofa

With a rugged industrial design, this repurposed supply crate is the perfect couch to sit and ponder your life choices. It might not be the most comfortable, but think of all the things you can store inside of it!
Resistance Supply Couch
Millennium Falcon ship docked at Hondo Ohnaka's Transport Solutions by Chewbacca. Occasionally used by Hondo for his "Legitimate Business"
Millennium Falcon
TIE echelon ship used by the First Order on Batuu.
TIE echelon
T-70 X-wing ship used by the Resistance on Batuu.
T-70 X-wing
Enjoy the latest hits from around the galaxy, and reminisce about good times spent at Oga's Cantina with this toy version of DJ R-3X.
DJ R-3X Stereo
Reclaimed from a destroyed Resistance bunker, this one of a kind table cannot be replicated. No, seriously... We have no idea where the other door went, so we were only able to make one.
Reclaimed Blast Test Table
What better way to bring that cozy feeling into your home than a uniquely designed coffee table. This table provides a warm glow that will make any room fill with a sense of warmth and comfort.
Industrial Luminescence
We can not go into detail of how we received these shipments from Oga's Cantina, but what we do know is it is a one-of-a-kind design that you will not find anywhere else.
Small Cantina Table
No. Seriously, stop asking us how we got this stuff. What Oga does not know won't hurt her. We have a contact on Batuu and that's all you need to know. Now enjoy the table.
Large Cantina Table
Okay this one was a gift from a friend, we can't really say more than that...
Cantina High Top Tables
Supply Crates are not just perfect for storing things, they also make excellent night stands or side tables.
Supply Crate Side Table
Do you want to feel the thrill of playing sabacc back on Batuu? Well look no further than this replica Cantina sabacc table. Now with even more colors!
Cantina Sabacc Table

The classic game of sabacc is well known throughout the galaxy and has been played for centuries. Sabacc is a peaceful and friendly card game, but when credits are involved, it ends up being nothing of the sort. Just be sure if you are playing with any Wookiees, well... you know what to do.
Sabacc Game Table
Crafted from the petrified trees on Batuu, this bench has all the natural aesthetics of wood without all those pesky splinters.
Petrified Bench
Crafted with state of the art fabric and steel, this tent can withstand serious shaking. Whether it be from a thermal detonator blast or... other things. This tent is built to last!
Resistance Tent
Dataspikes can be used to slice Control Panels and Holotables in Batuu. This can allow you to obtain sensitive information or even Galactic Credits.
Dataspike
This cute, soft Ewok plush toy is sure to delight children of all ages.
Plush Ewok
This cute plush porg is a delightful souvenir of a child's first trip to Batuu.
Plush Porg
This technical marvel of a trashcan is the galactic standard for waste disposal units. Watch as trash is dumped into the opening, it will vanish into oblivion! Where it goes...We don't even know!
Galactic Waste-No-Waste Bin
Supply crates like these can be found all over Batuu. They can hold valuable items. In order to access them you will need to successfully override their locks.
Locked Supply Crate

Large, sturdy, and crafted by artisans of Batuu, these large windows offer any home a unique and bold look. If you're looking for a clear, unobscured view of the outside world, this window is not for you!
Large Perforated Window
Similar to the Large Perforated Windows, just on a smaller scale. You can see even less of the outdoors!
Small Perforated Window
These parts can be used to repair or modify a T-70 X-wing.
T-70 X-wing Parts

Looking for rare and interesting collectibles? Dok-Ondar's Den of Antiquities has items gathered from all over the galaxy! It's across from Docking Bay 7!
Did you know that you can get special rewards for earning enough reputation with the different factions? You'll earn reputation with each mission you complete!

Looking for a droid companion? I'm flattered, really, but I'm bolted down in Oga's Cantina... You should head over to the First Order District and visit Mubo at the Droid Depot. He'll set you up with a droid based on your specifications. Just remember to bring some extra scrap metal with you!
Hey! Sweet datapad you've got there! Did you know that you can use your datapad to scan items around Batuu to learn more about them! Let's see if you can collect all of the scans!

Lightsaber? I have no idea what that is... are you with the First Order? No? Well in that case, find Savi's Workshop in Black Spire Outpost. Savi can set you up with a variety of hilts and kyber crystals to complete your first lightsaber! Ask about lightsaber challenges too!
There's a debate here in the outpost... Which milk is better, blue or green? Go find out for yourself at the Milk Stand in the First Order District!
If you're looking to change up your outfit while on Batuu, head to the Dwelling located across from Savi's Workshop in Black Spire Outpost.

I'm sure you've noticed that Black Spire Outpost has a variety of gourmet offerings from Docking Bay 7 and Ronto Roasters but did you know that you'll learn the recipe after eating each dish? Bring a taste of Batuu back to your home planet, traveler!
If Lt. Agnon can't find the Resistance on Batuu soon, Kylo Ren's going to be pretty angry! If you're looking to get involved in all of that, chat with Lt. Agnon in the First Order District.

The poor First Order... so frustrated! Try as they might, they just can't find the hidden Resistance base here on Batuu. If you really wanna help them, just head over to the First Order District and let Lt. Agnon know.
This next one goes out to the First Order officers talking about looking for a hidden Resistance base... If you really wanna help them, Speak with Lt. Agnon in the First Order District.
I hear the Resistance is hiding out in the forest but I can't check... because I'm bolted down! Hehe!
Looking to bring some hope to the galaxy? You should check the forest! I hear the Resistance is hiding out there! But keep it quiet around the First Order!
The First Order are searching for the Resistance here on Batuu. Maybe if they searched out in the forest, they'd find them... oh well!

If there are credits to be made, smugglers and scoundrels will always be there! As a matter of fact, you should talk to that guy over there... his name's Hondo Ohnaka and he may bring you in on his 'legitimate' business ventures if you ask nicely!

Some of my best friends are scoundrels... but maybe that's because I can't leave this cantina! Go meet with Hondo Ohnaka if you're looking for 'legitimate' business opportunities... he's right over there!
Owe any debts to some unsavory types? Talk to Hondo Ohnaka over there about his 'legitimate' business opportunities. The credits will be flowing and he may even share some with you! Hehe!

While on Batuu, you will use a different currency called Galactic Credits and have a special inventory (don't worry, your Simoleons and inventory contents are safe at home). To get started check your Career Panel for your first mission to help get your bearings.
Welcome to Batuu!
Use the Disruption Device on a First Order Control Panel in order to obtain the Encryption Sequence.
Disruption Device
Encryption Sequence
This Encryption Sequence can be used on the First Order security door, in the First Order Cargo building, in order to test its authenticity.
Prototype Blaster
After obtaining the Prototype Blaster. Return to the Scoundrel Informant and deliver it in exchange for the Disruption Device.
Classified Information
The scrap yard is where Mubo stores spare parts to sell, service, and trade droids of all types.
Batuu Record: Droid Depot Storage

The 1.4 FD P-Tower is a light fixed anti-vehicle weapon emplacement with enough power to disable any light vehicles. The P-Tower's rugged dependability meant it could function even in the harshest environments. Good thing we don't have to worry about any AT-M6's...
Batuu Record: 1.4 FD P-Tower

Strono "Cookie" Tuggs is one of the galaxy's most well-known culinary experts. He travels to various locations in his modified Sienar-Chall Utilipede Transport. His ship is built specifically to operate as a mobile kitchen and restaurant. Due to his extensive travels, he gathered some of the most exotic ingredients to make new and unusual dishes. The transport has a modular cargo cradle that can support several self-contained modules with built-in life support systems to ensure his ingredients stay as fresh as possible.
Batuu Record: Modified Utilipede Transport
Batuu Record: Black Spire Water Pipes

These pipes are used to transport water all across Black Spire Outpost, unfortunately a dianoga pup has worked its way into the system and it has refused to leave. If you look closely you can see its curious eyestalk pop up ever so often.

This salvage cart is used by Mubo, the owner of the Droid Depot, to gather supplies around Batuu to allow him to restore and build droids for his customers. Hand crafted with metal tubes and leather straps, it is not the most glorious of constructions, but it gets the job done.
Batuu Record: Salvage Cart
Gonk droids are portable power units and often need to be recharged when they run out of power. Mubo offers charging services for Batuu locals and their gonk droids... for a small fee.
Batuu Record: Recharging Gonk Droid
Batuu Record: FWMB-10 Repeating Blaster

The FWMB-10 Repeating Blaster is manufactured by Sonn-Blas Corporation and is used primarily by First Order megablaster heavy assault troopers. This blaster features an integrated stand to more easily mount and control for long periods of suppressive fire. In addition this model is powered by an Eksoan Class-5B1 duplex power generator.

Little more than walking batteries, Gonk power droids shuffle along, recharging vehicles and machinery as directed by their owners or programming. While there are many versions of power droids, most of them are similar in appearance. Power droids are a common sight throughout the galaxy, however they receive little notoriety despite their critical role in both military and civilian life.
Batuu Record: Gonk Droid
Batuu Record: Resistance Lockers

In between missions the Resistance needs to find time to rest and relax to keep their spirits up. The Resistance members on Batuu have constructed a small recreational room in the back of their bunker in order to maintain a small piece of civility while they continue to hold off the First Order at all costs.
Batuu Record: Millennium Falcon

A modified Corellian light freighter, the Millennium Falcon is a legend among smugglers and is touted as the fastest hunk of junk in the galaxy. Despite its humble origins, the ship that made the Kessel Run in less than 12 parsecs has played a critical role in some of the greatest victories of the Rebel Alliance and the New Republic. It's owners have included Lando Calrissian, Han Solo, and a handful of other scoundrels.\nThe Falcon currently resides in Batuu after Chewbacca made a deal with former pirate Hondo Ohnaka to lend him the ship in exchange for Hondo's aiding the Resistance.

Designed for deep space exploration and reconnaissance, probe droids are tenacious hunters and searchers. Probe droids have many sensors, and the ones used by the Empire were armed with blasters and, in some models, shields. Their goal, once arriving at their target location, is to gather as much information as possible. If confronted after their main mission has been completed these droids have the ability to self-destruct.
Batuu Record: Imperial Probe Droid

The X-34 is equipped with a powerful repulsorlift engine that allows it to hover a meter above ground. Enhanced by a trio of air-cooled thrust turbines, this speedy ride is a true work-orbak on any planet such as Batuu or Tatooine.
Batuu Record: X-34 Landspeeder
Batuu Record: Tactical Screen

In order to stay hidden from the prying eyes of the First Order, the Resistance has established a bunker in the forests of Batuu, outside Black Spire Outpost. These tactical screens are used to plan attack strategies and monitor traffic in and around their bunker. With advanced mapping technology, nothing will slip by the Resistance, as long as they are monitoring these screens.

Rumor has it that this not only an ancient spiritual relic of Ithor, the home planet of Dok-Ondar’s race, but also the gravestone of his parents. Ithorians are pacifist by nature and have a spirituality that is linked to plant-life. If you look closely, you can see an inscription at the base of the statute that reads, “We Wither to Bloom.”
Batuu Record: Ithorian Gravestone
Batuu Record: TIE echelon

The TIE echelon was manufactured by Sienar-Jaemus Fleet Systems and is primarily used for fleet transport. The echelon has enough capacity to carry twelve crew members plus additional cargo. Though it's used for mostly transportation, it's not without its armaments. Equipped with a shield generator, heavy laser cannons, and advanced sensors that are programmed to pick up enemy communications, the echelon also has the ability to change out its armaments as needed.
Batuu Record: DF.12 Com Turret

The DF.12 Com Turret is a ground-based turret emplacement that served as a reliable first line of defense for the Resistance. If this thing doesn't stop whatever is coming at you, I am not sure anything will.

The locals of Black Spire Outpost use scraps of fabric, ribbon or string, and tie them around this tree to make a wish. When the fabric or string falls away or disintegrates, the locals believe the galaxy will grant their wish.
Batuu Record: Trilon Wishing Tree
Batuu Record: Jedi Temple Statue

Instantly recognizable by its distinctive crown of five spires, the Jedi Temple was the home of the Jedi Order on Coruscant. Part school and part monastery, the Jedi Temple was the central hub for all Jedi activities in the galaxy during the Galactic Republic.
Batuu Record: T-70 X-wing

Used as the signature combat craft of the Resistance, this workhorse of a ship is one of the most versatile in the Resistance fleet. It has enough maneuverability to keep up with a TIE fighter, while still maintaining significant firepower to pack a punch. As the Resistance is credit-strapped, most X-wings are acquired as generous donations from senators and local security forces.

Rex, a former pilot of a Starspeeder 3000, is now programmed to be the DJ of Oga’s Cantina. He is known best for playing the latest hits from around the galaxy in the heart of Black Spire Outpost. He may not be the most precise droid but he’s still trying to do his best on the job.
